Mood and anxiety disorders

* Characterised depressive episode frequent (1 to 4%) in the over-65s.
* anxiety disorders > 10% in elderly subjects, with generalised anxiety disorder (most common in PA) and phobic disorders in the forefront. Panic disorder is rarer.
* Bipolar disorder about 1% in subjects over 60.

'''Aged and late-onset psychotic disorders'''

The prevalence of schizophrenia is lower than in the young adult population (0.6% vs. 1%) due to the high early mortality rate in these patients.

Alcohol and drug use disorders

* Alcohol: 3rd most common psychiatric disorder among the elderly.
* Difficulties linked to the use of medication: 39 to 55% of people aged over 65 take benzodiazepines and related products in France (see item 77).

----

question.title: What is the estimated prevalence of mood disorders in the elderly population?

option_a.title: More than 20% in the elderly population
option_a.description: A possible but less accurate estimate

option_b.title: Between 1 to 4% in the elderly population
option_b.description: A common estimate of depressive episodes in the elderly

option_c.title: Less than 5% in the elderly population
option_c.description: A possible underestimation of the true prevalence

option_d.title: Similar to that of young adults
option_d.description: A possible misconception about the prevalence of mood disorders in the elderly
